snippet: Regulators are poised to crack down on eight financial institutions that are not part of a recent settlement over foreclosure practices involving inadequate documents.
abstract: Federal regulators are poised to crack down on eight financial institutions that are not part of a recent settlement over foreclosure practices involving sloppy, inaccurate or forged documents; Federal Reserve is seeking fines for the additional firms, raising questions about how deep foreclosure problems run through the banking industry.
lead_paragraph: Regulators are poised to crack down on eight financial institutions that are not part of a recent settlement over foreclosure practices involving inadequate documents.

headline.seo: Foreclosure Inquiry by Federal Reserve Focuses on 8 More Firms
headline.main: As Foreclosure Problems Persist, Fed Seeks More Fines
headline.print_headline: As Foreclosure Problems Persist, Fed Seeks More Fines
